Utterance: <synch>
Welcome back! It’s nice to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
I’ve been okay. I’ve been trying to use the affirmations we talked about.
That’s wonderful to hear! How has that been going for you?
It’s been good. I feel a little more positive, but there are days when I still doubt myself.
It’s completely normal to have ups and downs. What do you do on those days when doubts creep in?
I try to remind myself of my accomplishments, but sometimes it’s hard to shake off the negative thoughts.
It can be challenging. Would you like to explore some additional coping strategies for those tough days?
Yes, that would be helpful.
One technique is mindfulness. Have you ever practiced mindfulness or meditation?
I haven’t really tried it, but I’ve heard about it.
Mindfulness can help you stay present and manage negative thoughts. Would you be interested in trying a short mindfulness exercise with me?
Sure, I’d like to try that.
Great! Let’s start by taking a few deep breaths together. Inhale deeply through your nose… hold it for a moment… and exhale slowly through your mouth. How does that feel?
It feels calming. I like it.
Wonderful! Now, let’s focus on the present moment. What do you notice around you?
I notice the sound of the air conditioning and the sunlight coming through the window.
Excellent observations! Mindfulness is about acknowledging your surroundings without judgment. This can help ground you when you feel overwhelmed. How do you feel after this exercise?
I feel more relaxed. I think I could use this when I’m feeling anxious.
Absolutely! You can use mindfulness anytime. Would you like to set a goal to practice this daily?
Yes, I’ll try to do it every morning.
That sounds like a great plan! Now, let’s check in on your job search. Have you had any new opportunities come up?
I applied to a couple of places, but I haven’t heard back yet.
It’s great that you’re applying! Remember, it can take time to hear back. How do you feel about the applications you’ve submitted?
I feel good about them. I think I put my best foot forward.
That’s a positive mindset! Let’s celebrate that effort. What else can we do to enhance your job search strategy?
Maybe I could network more? I haven’t really reached out to anyone.
Networking is a great idea! Connecting with others can lead to new opportunities. Do you have any contacts in the child development field?
I have a few former classmates and some people from my volunteer work.
Perfect! Would you be comfortable reaching out to them to see if they know of any openings?
Yes, I think I could do that. It’s a bit intimidating, though.
It’s understandable to feel that way. You can start with a simple message expressing your interest in any job leads. Would you like to draft a message together?
Yes, that would help.

Let’s start with a greeting, then mention your current job search. How about something like, “Hi [Name], I hope you’re doing well! I’m currently looking for job opportunities in child development and would appreciate any leads you might have.” What do you think?
That sounds good! I can add a bit about what I’m looking for.
Absolutely! Personalizing it will make it more engaging. Once you feel comfortable, send it out. How does that feel?
It feels manageable. I’ll give it a shot!
Great! Let’s check in on your feelings about being a single parent. How has that been for you lately?
It’s been a bit overwhelming with everything going on, but I’m managing.
It’s commendable that you’re managing. Are there specific challenges you’re facing?
Sometimes I feel guilty about not being able to provide everything I want for my daughter.
Guilt is a common feeling among parents. Remember, your love and support are what matter most. How do you think you can address those feelings?
I guess I could focus on the quality time we spend together rather than material things.
That’s a wonderful perspective! Quality time can create lasting memories. What activities do you enjoy doing together?
We like to go to the park and watch movies at home. Simple things, but we enjoy them.
Those sound like lovely activities! Perhaps you can plan regular outings to strengthen your bond. Would you like to set a goal for that?
Yes, I’d like to make it a weekly thing.
Perfect! Having that time together can also help you both unwind. Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I think I’m good for now. I feel like we covered a lot.
I agree! You’ve made great strides. Remember to practice your affirmations and mindfulness, and reach out to your contacts. I’m looking forward to hearing about your progress in our next session!
Thank you! I appreciate your support.
You’re welcome! Take care, and see you next time!
Goodbye!
